response.answer_text: Eurovision was founded in 1956 in London, England, as a way to reunite a Europe divided by World War II. The meeting consisted of the main public service broadcasters (such as BBC), who agreed to broadcast the event live. 7 countries participated in the first event, sending a singer and an orchestra. One cameraman filmed the whole event. Since then, Eurovision has played host to almost every country in Europe, plus Australia and Israel. Tens of millions watch the event live each year. Eurovision has made stars out of acts like Loreen, ABBA, Manz Zelmerlöw, Lulu, Lordi and even the world famous Riverdance - which was the interval act at the 1994 Contest in Dublin, Ireland. Thousands now host Eurovision parties each year. It's a real occasion.
